discussion.p:
The effects of starts_with are described as equivalent to return compare(0, npos, x) == 0.
This is incorrect, because it returns false when you check to see if any sequence begins with the empty sequence. (There are other failure cases, but that one's easy)
As a drive-by fix, we can make the Effects: for starts_with and ends_with clearer.
Those are the second and proposed third changes, and they are not required.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4713.

blockquote.pre: constexpr bool starts_with(basic_string_view x) const noexcept;

blockquote.p: -20- Effects: Equivalent to: return size() >= x.size() && compare(0, nposx.size(), x) == 0;

blockquote.pre: constexpr bool starts_with(charT x) const noexcept;

blockquote.p: -21- Effects: Equivalent to: return !empty() && traits::eq(front(), x)starts_with(basic_string_view(&x, 1));

blockquote.pre: constexpr bool ends_with(charT x) const noexcept;

blockquote.p: -24- Effects: Equivalent to: return !empty() && traits::eq(back(), x)ends_with(basic_string_view(&x, 1));
